lineage.Process: Copy relevant contents of /production/geodata/dss/v3/ab and MySQL:geodata

descript.abstract: The Polygon Attribute Table (PAT) provides the linkage between geographic locations (polygons) and soil attributes in the associated database tables.
descript.purpose: The Alberta Polygon Attribute Table (PAT) forms part of the Soil Information Database for the province of Alberta (ABSID)
descript.supplinf: Additional information can be found on the Canadian Soil Information System (CanSIS) website at http://sis.agr.gc.ca/cansis/nsdb/dss/v3/index.html

citeinfo.title: Alberta Component Table (CMP)

pubinfo.publish: Government of Canada / Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada (AAFC)

crossref.assndesc: The Component File (CMP) contains the soil and landscape elements required to characterize a soil polygon, for one or more distinct soil components. Polygons are connected to the CMP through the common POLY_ID field via a many-to-many (N:N) relationship.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntorgp.cntorg: Government of Canada / Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada (AAFC)

attr.attrdef: Polygon Identifier: This polygon identifier is used to join attribute datasets (such as the CMP) to the Polygon Attribute Table (PAT). More than one polygon in the spatial dataset may share the same POLY_ID. This field is a concatenation of the survey identifier (6 characters) and a 6 character feature identifier.
attr.attrdefs: Canadian Soil Information Service (CanSIS). The complete definition of this attribute is found at http://sis.agr.gc.ca/cansis/nsdb/soil/v2/snt/poly_id.html

attr.attrdef: Total area of the polygon: This is the total area, including land and fresh water, of the entire soil polygon.
attr.attrdefs: Canadian Soil Information Service (CanSIS). The complete definition of this attribute is found at http://sis.agr.gc.ca/cansis/nsdb/soil/v2/snt/hectares.html

dataqual.logic: The soil polygon linework is compiled from numerous tiles of different scaled soil maps. The spatial resolution and accuracy is variable and is dependent on the original source. In some cases polygons along adjoining tiles have been edgematched to each other, but in other cases they have not.
dataqual.complete: ABSID contains information for the agricultural areas of Alberta and part of the non-agricultural areas, but it does not cover the whole province.
